I also recommend watching "Lord of War." This film stars Liya Kebede, Tony Kgoroge, Jeremy Crutchley, Jared Burke, Nicolas Cage, Nicolas Cage, Eamonn Walker. The plot of this film revolves around an arms dealer who confronts the morality of his work as he is being chased by an INTERPOL Agent.
Both "The Good German" and "Lord of War" are highly rated movies that showcase various aspects of human nature, society, culture, and politics.
I hope you enjoy these recommendations.

I highly recommend Insidious, especially if you enjoy stories that challenge your assumptions and keep you on edge.

In Insidious, a talented twenty-one year old filmmaker named Donny Rocchi is estranged from his mother, and never knowing his dead father, Donny sets out to collect on debts owed, and is dragged deep into a seductive ambush that turns his world upside down. Donny reaches out for help from a "connected" Mulberry Street café owner, Gigetto, who has more problems than just the Russian mob.
